page.title: 11CLITHEROE CRICKET CLUB
page.content: The cricket grounds consist of a netball court, bowling green, squash club, three tennis courts and the cricket field. There is also a club house with changing rooms. The first cricket club house was demolished in 1933. A new club house was then built and opened in 1935 at a cost of Â£900. The money was collected by private subscription and social efforts. Cricket practices are held on Monday and Thursday. Tennis and netball can be played at any time of the week. The bowling green is in the corner and is mainly used by the older generation. The netball courts are normally used for matches, but the tennis courts are often full up. The membership for the Cricket Club is Â£14 for one year, the Tennis Club is Â£7 and Squash Club is Â£48.
